What is the `z_importkey` command in Verus, and how do I use it to add a zkey to my wallet, including optional parameters for rescan and start height?

The `z_importkey` command in Verus is used to add a zkey, which is a special type of key generated by the `z_exportkey` command, to your wallet. This command allows you to import a zkey and optionally rescan your wallet for transactions.

The basic syntax of the command is as follows:
```
z_importkey "zkey" (rescan startHeight)
```
Here, `"zkey"` is a required string argument that specifies the zkey you want to import. The `rescan` and `startHeight` parameters are optional.

The `rescan` parameter determines whether the wallet should be rescanned for transactions. It can take one of three values: `"yes"`, `"no"`, or `"whenkeyisnew"`. If `rescan` is set to `"yes"`, the wallet will be fully rescanned, which can take some time. If set to `"no"`, no rescan will be performed. If set to `"whenkeyisnew"` (which is the default), the wallet will only be rescanned if the key is new.

The `startHeight` parameter specifies the block height from which to start the rescan. This parameter is only relevant if `rescan` is set to `"yes"` or `"whenkeyisnew"`.

Here are some examples of how to use the `z_importkey` command:
```
# Import a zkey with a full rescan
verus z_importkey "mykey" yes

# Import a zkey with a partial rescan starting from block height 30000
verus z_importkey "mykey" whenkeyisnew 30000

# Import a zkey without rescanning
verus z_importkey "mykey" no
```
Note that the `z_importkey` command can take some time to complete if a rescan is performed. Additionally, you can also use this command as a JSON-RPC call, as shown in the example:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importkey", "params": ["mykey", "no"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

z_importkey "zkey" ( rescan startHeight )

Adds a zkey (as returned by z_exportkey) to your wallet.

Arguments:
1. "zkey"       (string, required) The zkey (see z_exportkey)
2. rescan        (string, optional, default="whenkeyisnew") Rescan the wallet for transactions - can be "yes", "no" or "whenkeyisnew"
3. startHeight     (numeric, optional, default=0) Block height to start rescan from

Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true.

Examples:

Export a zkey
> verus z_exportkey "myaddress"

Import the zkey with rescan
> verus z_importkey "mykey"

Import the zkey with partial rescan
> verus z_importkey "mykey" whenkeyisnew 30000

Re-import the zkey with longer partial rescan
> verus z_importkey "mykey" yes 20000

As a JSON-RPC call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importkey", "params": ["mykey", "no"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
